articles.author: Stuart Clark
articles.title: ‘It’s like finding needles in a haystack’: the mission to discover if Jupiter’s moons support life - The Guardian
articles.description: The European Space Agency’s Juice mission launches next month, flying closer to icy moons – including Ganymede, the solar system’s largest – than ever before
articles.content: For most of the past 200 years, were you to ask an astronomer where the most likely place in the solar system is to find life, the answer will have been Mars. The red planet and its potential inhabit… [+12944 chars]
